alert.note: Alert for Anderson; Greenville; Laurens; Pickens; Spartanburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued February 17 at 11:30PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MIDNIGHT EST FOR NORTHWESTERN LAURENS...SOUTHEASTERN GREENVILLE...CENTRAL SPARTANBURG...NORTHEASTERN ANDERSON AND EAST CENTRAL PICKENS COUNTIES... At 1129 PM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Easley to 6 miles south of Clemson, moving east at 70 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Greenville, Spartanburg, Easley, Greer, Mauldin, Taylors, Simpsonville and Berea. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...OBSERVED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A few trees and power lines will be blown down in the warned area. Storms will be accompanied by brief heavy rainfall, and little or no lightning. Seek shelter inside an interior room. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
